issues.description: The problem statement explicitly requires calculateTotalPrice to be a static method (see the note listing which methods/attributes must be static). However, in the solution SealSaloon.calculateTotalPrice is implemented as an instance method (non-static). This mismatch between the specification and the provided solution can confuse students about whether the method should be static, and it may cause inconsistencies in expected usage (e.g., calling SealSaloon.calculateTotalPrice(...) vs. instance.calculateTotalPrice(...)) or in tests that expect a static method.
issues.suggested_fix: Make the calculateTotalPrice method static in the implementation to match the problem statement. For example, change its signature to public static int calculateTotalPrice(Meal meal) and update any call sites to use SealSaloon.calculateTotalPrice(...). Ensure the template (and any tests) also expect the static signature so students and the reference solution are consistent with the specification.
